results.title: Metformin versus sibutramine in the treatment of hyperinsulinemia in chronically anovulating women.
results.text_hl: Aim of this study was to compare the effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and a body weight reduction regimen using @CHEMICAL_sibutramine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C058254 @@@sibutramine@@@ on insulinemia, @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ sensitivity, and ovarian function in @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Cycling</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000091622 @@@anovulatory cycles@@@ or @DISEASE_Infertility @DISEASE_MESH:D007246 @@@infertility@@@. 30 @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Cycling</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000091622 @@@anovulatory cycles@@@ and @DISEASE_Hyperinsulinism @DISEASE_MESH:D006946 @@@hyperinsulinemia@@@ were treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and 15 @DISEASE_Anovulation @DISEASE_MESH:D000858 @@@anovulating@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@ were treated with @CHEMICAL_sibutramine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C058254 @@@sibutramine@@@ in combination with a caloric restriction diet and physical exercise.

citations.NLM: Lazurova I, Dravecka I, Kraus V, Petrovicova J. Metformin versus sibutramine in the treatment of hyperinsulinemia in chronically anovulating women. Bratisl Lek Listy. 2004;105(5-6):207-10. PMID: 15535111
